scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Upon agreement from us to his liking,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Will undertake to woo curst Katharina,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Yea, and to marry her, if her dowry please.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: So said, so done, is well.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Hortensio, have you told him all her faults?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: I know she is an irksome brawling scold:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: If that be all, masters, I hear no harm.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: No, say'st me so, friend? What countryman?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Born in Verona, old Antonio's son:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: My father dead, my fortune lives for me;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And I do hope good days and long to see.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: O sir, such a life, with such a wife, were strange!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: But if you have a stomach, to't i' God's name:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: You shall have me assisting you in all.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: But will you woo this wild-cat?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Will I live?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Will he woo her? ay, or I'll hang her.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Why came I hither but to that intent?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Think you a little din can daunt mine ears?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Have I not in my time heard lions roar?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Have I not heard the sea puff'd up with winds
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Rage like an angry boar chafed with sweat?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Have I not heard great ordnance in the field,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And heaven's artillery thunder in the skies?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Have I not in a pitched battle heard
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Loud 'larums, neighing steeds, and trumpets' clang?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And do you tell me of a woman's tongue,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: That gives not half so great a blow to hear
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: As will a chestnut in a farmer's fire?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Tush, tush! fear boys with bugs.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: For he fears none.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Hortensio, hark:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: This gentleman is happily arrived,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: My mind presumes, for his own good and ours.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: I promised we would be contributors
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And bear his charging of wooing, whatsoe'er.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And so we will, provided that he win her.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: I would I were as sure of a good dinner.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Gentlemen, God save you. If I may be bold,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Tell me, I beseech you, which is the readiest way
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: To the house of Signior Baptista Minola?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: He that has the two fair daughters: is't he you mean?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Even he, Biondello.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Hark you, sir; you mean not her to--
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Perhaps, him and her, sir: what have you to do?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Not her that chides, sir, at any hand, I pray.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: I love no chiders, sir. Biondello, let's away.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Well begun, Tranio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, a word ere you go;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Are you a suitor to the maid you talk of, yea or no?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And if I be, sir, is it any offence?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: No; if without more words you will get you hence.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Why, sir, I pray, are not the streets as free
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: For me as for you?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: But so is not she.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: For what reason, I beseech you?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: For this reason, if you'll know,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: That she's the choice love of Signior Gremio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: That she's the chosen of Signior Hortensio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Softly, my masters! if you be gentlemen,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Do me this right; hear me with patience.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Baptista is a noble gentleman,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: To whom my father is not all unknown;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And were his daughter fairer than she is,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: She may more suitors have and me for one.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Fair Leda's daughter had a thousand wooers;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Then well one more may fair Bianca have:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And so she shall; Lucentio shall make one,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Though Paris came in hope to speed alone.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: What! this gentleman will out-talk us all.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, give him head: I know he'll prove a jade.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Hortensio, to what end are all these words?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, let me be so bold as ask you,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Did you yet ever see Baptista's daughter?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: No, sir; but hear I do that he hath two,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: The one as famous for a scolding tongue
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: As is the other for beauteous modesty.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, sir, the first's for me; let her go by.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Yea, leave that labour to great Hercules;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And let it be more than Alcides' twelve.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, understand you this of me in sooth:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: The youngest daughter whom you hearken for
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Her father keeps from all access of suitors,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And will not promise her to any man
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Until the elder sister first be wed:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: The younger then is free and not before.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: If it be so, sir, that you are the man
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Must stead us all and me amongst the rest,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And if you break the ice and do this feat,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Achieve the elder, set the younger free
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: For our access, whose hap shall be to have her
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Will not so graceless be to be ingrate.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, you say well and well you do conceive;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And since you do profess to be a suitor,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: You must, as we do, gratify this gentleman,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: To whom we all rest generally beholding.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, I shall not be slack: in sign whereof,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Please ye we may contrive this afternoon,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And quaff carouses to our mistress' health,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: And do as adversaries do in law,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Strive mightily, but eat and drink as friends.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: O excellent motion! Fellows, let's be gone.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: The motion's good indeed and be it so,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Petruchio, I shall be your ben venuto.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before HORTENSIO'S house.

line_text: Good sister, wrong me not, nor wrong yourself,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To make a bondmaid and a slave of me;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That I disdain: but for these other gawds,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Unbind my hands, I'll pull them off myself,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Yea, all my raiment, to my petticoat;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Or what you will command me will I do,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: So well I know my duty to my elders.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Of all thy suitors, here I charge thee, tell
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Whom thou lovest best: see thou dissemble not.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Believe me, sister, of all the men alive
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I never yet beheld that special face
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Which I could fancy more than any other.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Minion, thou liest. Is't not Hortensio?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If you affect him, sister, here I swear
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I'll plead for you myself, but you shall have
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: him.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O then, belike, you fancy riches more:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You will have Gremio to keep you fair.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Is it for him you do envy me so?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Nay then you jest, and now I well perceive
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You have but jested with me all this while:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I prithee, sister Kate, untie my hands.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If that be jest, then all the rest was so.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why, how now, dame! whence grows this insolence?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Bianca, stand aside. Poor girl! she weeps.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Go ply thy needle; meddle not with her.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For shame, thou helding of a devilish spirit,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why dost thou wrong her that did ne'er wrong thee?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: When did she cross thee with a bitter word?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Her silence flouts me, and I'll be revenged.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What, in my sight? Bianca, get thee in.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What, will you not suffer me? Nay, now I see
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: She is your treasure, she must have a husband;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I must dance bare-foot on her wedding day
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And for your love to her lead apes in hell.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Talk not to me: I will go sit and weep
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Till I can find occasion of revenge.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Was ever gentleman thus grieved as I?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But who comes here?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Good morrow, neighbour Baptista.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Good morrow, neighbour Gremio.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: God save you, gentlemen!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And you, good sir! Pray, have you not a daughter
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Call'd Katharina, fair and virtuous?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I have a daughter, sir, called Katharina.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You are too blunt: go to it orderly.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You wrong me, Signior Gremio: give me leave.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I am a gentleman of Verona, sir,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That, hearing of her beauty and her wit,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Her affability and bashful modesty,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Her wondrous qualities and mild behavior,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Am bold to show myself a forward guest
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Within your house, to make mine eye the witness
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Of that report which I so oft have heard.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And, for an entrance to my entertainment,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I do present you with a man of mine,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Cunning in music and the mathematics,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To instruct her fully in those sciences,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Whereof I know she is not ignorant:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Accept of him, or else you do me wrong:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: His name is Licio, born in Mantua.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You're welcome, sir; and he, for your good sake.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But for my daughter Katharina, this I know,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: She is not for your turn, the more my grief.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I see you do not mean to part with her,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Or else you like not of my company.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Mistake me not; I speak but as I find.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Whence are you, sir? what may I call your name?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Petruchio is my name; Antonio's son,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A man well known throughout all Italy.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I know him well: you are welcome for his sake.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Saving your tale, Petruchio, I pray,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Let us, that are poor petitioners, speak too:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Baccare! you are marvellous forward.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O, pardon me, Signior Gremio; I would fain be doing.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I doubt it not, sir; but you will curse your
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: wooing. Neighbour, this is a gift very grateful, I am
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: sure of it. To express the like kindness, myself,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: that have been more kindly beholding to you than
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: any, freely give unto you this young scholar,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: that hath been long studying at Rheims; as cunning
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: in Greek, Latin, and other languages, as the other
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: in music and mathematics: his name is Cambio; pray,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: accept his service.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A thousand thanks, Signior Gremio.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Welcome, good Cambio.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But, gentle sir, methinks you walk like a stranger:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: may I be so bold to know the cause of your coming?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Pardon me, sir, the boldness is mine own,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That, being a stranger in this city here,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Do make myself a suitor to your daughter,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Unto Bianca, fair and virtuous.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Nor is your firm resolve unknown to me,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: In the preferment of the eldest sister.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: This liberty is all that I request,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That, upon knowledge of my parentage,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I may have welcome 'mongst the rest that woo
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And free access and favour as the rest:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And, toward the education of your daughters,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I here bestow a simple instrument,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And this small packet of Greek and Latin books:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If you accept them, then their worth is great.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Lucentio is your name; of whence, I pray?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Of Pisa, sir; son to Vincentio.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A mighty man of Pisa; by report
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I know him well: you are very welcome, sir,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Take you the lute, and you the set of books;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You shall go see your pupils presently.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Holla, within!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Sirrah, lead these gentlemen
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To my daughters; and tell them both,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: These are their tutors: bid them use them well.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: We will go walk a little in the orchard,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And then to dinner. You are passing welcome,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And so I pray you all to think yourselves.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Signior Baptista, my business asketh haste,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And every day I cannot come to woo.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You knew my father well, and in him me,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Left solely heir to all his lands and goods,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Which I have better'd rather than decreased:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Then tell me, if I get your daughter's love,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What dowry shall I have with her to wife?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: After my death the one half of my lands,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And in possession twenty thousand crowns.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And, for that dowry, I'll assure her of
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Her widowhood, be it that she survive me,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: In all my lands and leases whatsoever:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Let specialties be therefore drawn between us,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That covenants may be kept on either hand.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Ay, when the special thing is well obtain'd,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That is, her love; for that is all in all.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why, that is nothing: for I tell you, father,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I am as peremptory as she proud-minded;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And where two raging fires meet together
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: They do consume the thing that feeds their fury:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Though little fire grows great with little wind,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Yet extreme gusts will blow out fire and all:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: So I to her and so she yields to me;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For I am rough and woo not like a babe.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Well mayst thou woo, and happy be thy speed!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But be thou arm'd for some unhappy words.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Ay, to the proof; as mountains are for winds,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That shake not, though they blow perpetually.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: How now, my friend! why dost thou look so pale?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For fear, I promise you, if I look pale.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What, will my daughter prove a good musician?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I think she'll sooner prove a soldier
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Iron may hold with her, but never lutes.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why, then thou canst not break her to the lute?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why, no; for she hath broke the lute to me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I did but tell her she mistook her frets,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And bow'd her hand to teach her fingering;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: When, with a most impatient devilish spirit,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Frets, call you these?' quoth she; 'I'll fume
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: with them:'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And, with that word, she struck me on the head,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And through the instrument my pate made way;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And there I stood amazed for a while,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: As on a pillory, looking through the lute;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: While she did call me rascal fiddler
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And twangling Jack; with twenty such vile terms,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: As had she studied to misuse me so.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Now, by the world, it is a lusty wench;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I love her ten times more than e'er I did:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O, how I long to have some chat with her!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Well, go with me and be not so discomfited:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Proceed in practise with my younger daughter;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: She's apt to learn and thankful for good turns.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Signior Petruchio, will you go with us,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Or shall I send my daughter Kate to you?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I pray you do.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I will attend her here,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And woo her with some spirit when she comes.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Say that she rail; why then I'll tell her plain
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: She sings as sweetly as a nightingale:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Say that she frown, I'll say she looks as clear
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: As morning roses newly wash'd with dew:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Say she be mute and will not speak a word;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Then I'll commend her volubility,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And say she uttereth piercing eloquence:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If she do bid me pack, I'll give her thanks,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: As though she bid me stay by her a week:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If she deny to wed, I'll crave the day
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: When I shall ask the banns and when be married.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But here she comes; and now, Petruchio, speak.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Good morrow, Kate; for that's your name, I hear.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Well have you heard, but something hard of hearing:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: They call me Katharina that do talk of me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You lie, in faith; for you are call'd plain Kate,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And bonny Kate and sometimes Kate the curst;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But Kate, the prettiest Kate in Christendom
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Kate of Kate Hall, my super-dainty Kate,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For dainties are all Kates, and therefore, Kate,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Take this of me, Kate of my consolation;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Hearing thy mildness praised in every town,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Thy virtues spoke of, and thy beauty sounded,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Yet not so deeply as to thee belongs,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Myself am moved to woo thee for my wife.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Moved! in good time: let him that moved you hither
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Remove you hence: I knew you at the first
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You were a moveable.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why, what's a moveable?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A join'd-stool.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Thou hast hit it: come, sit on me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Asses are made to bear, and so are you.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Women are made to bear, and so are you.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: No such jade as you, if me you mean.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Alas! good Kate, I will not burden thee;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For, knowing thee to be but young and light--
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Too light for such a swain as you to catch;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And yet as heavy as my weight should be.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Should be! should--buzz!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Well ta'en, and like a buzzard.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O slow-wing'd turtle! shall a buzzard take thee?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Ay, for a turtle, as he takes a buzzard.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Come, come, you wasp; i' faith, you are too angry.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If I be waspish, best beware my sting.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: My remedy is then, to pluck it out.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Ay, if the fool could find it where it lies,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Who knows not where a wasp does
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: wear his sting? In his tail.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: In his tongue.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Whose tongue?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Yours, if you talk of tails: and so farewell.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What, with my tongue in your tail? nay, come again,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Good Kate; I am a gentleman.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That I'll try.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I swear I'll cuff you, if you strike again.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: So may you lose your arms:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If you strike me, you are no gentleman;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And if no gentleman, why then no arms.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A herald, Kate? O, put me in thy books!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What is your crest? a coxcomb?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A combless cock, so Kate will be my hen.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: No cock of mine; you crow too like a craven.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Nay, come, Kate, come; you must not look so sour.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: It is my fashion, when I see a crab.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why, here's no crab; and therefore look not sour.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: There is, there is.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Then show it me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Had I a glass, I would.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What, you mean my face?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Well aim'd of such a young one.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Now, by Saint George, I am too young for you.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Yet you are wither'd.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Tis with cares.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I care not.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Nay, hear you, Kate: in sooth you scape not so.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I chafe you, if I tarry: let me go.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: No, not a whit: I find you passing gentle.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Twas told me you were rough and coy and sullen,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And now I find report a very liar;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For thou are pleasant, gamesome, passing courteous,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But slow in speech, yet sweet as spring-time flowers:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Thou canst not frown, thou canst not look askance,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Nor bite the lip, as angry wenches will,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Nor hast thou pleasure to be cross in talk,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But thou with mildness entertain'st thy wooers,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: With gentle conference, soft and affable.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why does the world report that Kate doth limp?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O slanderous world! Kate like the hazel-twig
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Is straight and slender and as brown in hue
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: As hazel nuts and sweeter than the kernels.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O, let me see thee walk: thou dost not halt.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Go, fool, and whom thou keep'st command.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Did ever Dian so become a grove
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: As Kate this chamber with her princely gait?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O, be thou Dian, and let her be Kate;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And then let Kate be chaste and Dian sportful!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Where did you study all this goodly speech?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: It is extempore, from my mother-wit.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A witty mother! witless else her son.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Am I not wise?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Yes; keep you warm.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Marry, so I mean, sweet Katharina, in thy bed:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And therefore, setting all this chat aside,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Thus in plain terms: your father hath consented
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That you shall be my wife; your dowry 'greed on;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And, Will you, nill you, I will marry you.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Now, Kate, I am a husband for your turn;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For, by this light, whereby I see thy beauty,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Thy beauty, that doth make me like thee well,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Thou must be married to no man but me;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For I am he am born to tame you Kate,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And bring you from a wild Kate to a Kate
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Conformable as other household Kates.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Here comes your father: never make denial;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I must and will have Katharina to my wife.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Now, Signior Petruchio, how speed you with my daughter?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: How but well, sir? how but well?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: It were impossible I should speed amiss.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why, how now, daughter Katharina! in your dumps?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Call you me daughter? now, I promise you
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You have show'd a tender fatherly regard,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To wish me wed to one half lunatic;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A mad-cup ruffian and a swearing Jack,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That thinks with oaths to face the matter out.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Father, 'tis thus: yourself and all the world,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That talk'd of her, have talk'd amiss of her:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If she be curst, it is for policy,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For she's not froward, but modest as the dove;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: She is not hot, but temperate as the morn;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For patience she will prove a second Grissel,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And Roman Lucrece for her chastity:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And to conclude, we have 'greed so well together,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That upon Sunday is the wedding-day.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I'll see thee hang'd on Sunday first.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Hark, Petruchio; she says she'll see thee
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: hang'd first.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Is this your speeding? nay, then, good night our part!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Be patient, gentlemen; I choose her for myself:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If she and I be pleased, what's that to you?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Tis bargain'd 'twixt us twain, being alone,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That she shall still be curst in company.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I tell you, 'tis incredible to believe
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: How much she loves me: O, the kindest Kate!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: She hung about my neck; and kiss on kiss
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: She vied so fast, protesting oath on oath,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That in a twink she won me to her love.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O, you are novices! 'tis a world to see,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: How tame, when men and women are alone,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A meacock wretch can make the curstest shrew.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Give me thy hand, Kate: I will unto Venice,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To buy apparel 'gainst the wedding-day.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Provide the feast, father, and bid the guests;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I will be sure my Katharina shall be fine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I know not what to say: but give me your hands;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: God send you joy, Petruchio! 'tis a match.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Amen, say we: we will be witnesses.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Father, and wife, and gentlemen, adieu;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I will to Venice; Sunday comes apace:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: We will have rings and things and fine array;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And kiss me, Kate, we will be married o'Sunday.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Was ever match clapp'd up so suddenly?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Faith, gentlemen, now I play a merchant's part,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And venture madly on a desperate mart.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Twas a commodity lay fretting by you:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Twill bring you gain, or perish on the seas.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: The gain I seek is, quiet in the match.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: No doubt but he hath got a quiet catch.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But now, Baptists, to your younger daughter:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Now is the day we long have looked for:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I am your neighbour, and was suitor first.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And I am one that love Bianca more
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Than words can witness, or your thoughts can guess.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Youngling, thou canst not love so dear as I.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Graybeard, thy love doth freeze.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But thine doth fry.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Skipper, stand back: 'tis age that nourisheth.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But youth in ladies' eyes that flourisheth.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Content you, gentlemen: I will compound this strife:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Tis deeds must win the prize; and he of both
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That can assure my daughter greatest dower
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Shall have my Bianca's love.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Say, Signior Gremio, What can you assure her?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: First, as you know, my house within the city
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Is richly furnished with plate and gold;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Basins and ewers to lave her dainty hands;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: My hangings all of Tyrian tapestry;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: In ivory coffers I have stuff'd my crowns;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: In cypress chests my arras counterpoints,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Costly apparel, tents, and canopies,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Fine linen, Turkey cushions boss'd with pearl,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Valance of Venice gold in needlework,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Pewter and brass and all things that belong
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To house or housekeeping: then, at my farm
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I have a hundred milch-kine to the pail,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Sixscore fat oxen standing in my stalls,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And all things answerable to this portion.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Myself am struck in years, I must confess;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And if I die to-morrow, this is hers,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If whilst I live she will be only mine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That 'only' came well in. Sir, list to me:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I am my father's heir and only son:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If I may have your daughter to my wife,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I'll leave her houses three or four as good,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Within rich Pisa walls, as any one
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Old Signior Gremio has in Padua;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Besides two thousand ducats by the year
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Of fruitful land, all which shall be her jointure.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What, have I pinch'd you, Signior Gremio?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Two thousand ducats by the year of land!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: My land amounts not to so much in all:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That she shall have; besides an argosy
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That now is lying in Marseilles' road.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What, have I choked you with an argosy?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Gremio, 'tis known my father hath no less
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Than three great argosies; besides two galliases,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And twelve tight galleys: these I will assure her,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And twice as much, whate'er thou offer'st next.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Nay, I have offer'd all, I have no more;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And she can have no more than all I have:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If you like me, she shall have me and mine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why, then the maid is mine from all the world,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: By your firm promise: Gremio is out-vied.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I must confess your offer is the best;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And, let your father make her the assurance,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: She is your own; else, you must pardon me,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: if you should die before him, where's her dower?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That's but a cavil: he is old, I young.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And may not young men die, as well as old?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Well, gentlemen,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I am thus resolved: on Sunday next you know
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: My daughter Katharina is to be married:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Now, on the Sunday following, shall Bianca
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Be bride to you, if you this assurance;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If not, Signior Gremio:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And so, I take my leave, and thank you both.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Adieu, good neighbour.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Now I fear thee not:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Sirrah young gamester, your father were a fool
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To give thee all, and in his waning age
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Set foot under thy table: tut, a toy!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: An old Italian fox is not so kind, my boy.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A vengeance on your crafty wither'd hide!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Yet I have faced it with a card of ten.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Tis in my head to do my master good:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I see no reason but supposed Lucentio
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Must get a father, call'd 'supposed Vincentio;'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And that's a wonder: fathers commonly
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Do get their children; but in this case of wooing,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A child shall get a sire, if I fail not of my cunning.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. A room in BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Fiddler, forbear; you grow too forward, sir:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Have you so soon forgot the entertainment
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Her sister Katharina welcomed you withal?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But, wrangling pedant, this is
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: The patroness of heavenly harmony:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Then give me leave to have prerogative;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And when in music we have spent an hour,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Your lecture shall have leisure for as much.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Preposterous ass, that never read so far
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To know the cause why music was ordain'd!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Was it not to refresh the mind of man
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: After his studies or his usual pain?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Then give me leave to read philosophy,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And while I pause, serve in your harmony.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Sirrah, I will not bear these braves of thine.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Why, gentlemen, you do me double wrong,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To strive for that which resteth in my choice:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I am no breeching scholar in the schools;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I'll not be tied to hours nor 'pointed times,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But learn my lessons as I please myself.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And, to cut off all strife, here sit we down:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Take you your instrument, play you the whiles;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: His lecture will be done ere you have tuned.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You'll leave his lecture when I am in tune?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That will be never: tune your instrument.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Where left we last?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Here, madam:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Hic ibat Simois; hic est Sigeia tellus;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Hic steterat Priami regia celsa senis.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Construe them.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Hic ibat,' as I told you before, 'Simois,' I am
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Lucentio, 'hic est,' son unto Vincentio of Pisa,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Sigeia tellus,' disguised thus to get your love;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Hic steterat,' and that Lucentio that comes
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: a-wooing, 'Priami,' is my man Tranio, 'regia,'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: bearing my port, 'celsa senis,' that we might
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: beguile the old pantaloon.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Madam, my instrument's in tune.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Let's hear. O fie! the treble jars.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Spit in the hole, man, and tune again.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Now let me see if I can construe it: 'Hic ibat
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Simois,' I know you not, 'hic est Sigeia tellus,' I
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: trust you not; 'Hic steterat Priami,' take heed
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: he hear us not, 'regia,' presume not, 'celsa senis,'
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: despair not.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Madam, 'tis now in tune.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: All but the base.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: The base is right; 'tis the base knave that jars.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: How fiery and forward our pedant is!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Now, for my life, the knave doth court my love:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Pedascule, I'll watch you better yet.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. BAPTISTA'S house.
