scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Here, sir; as foolish as I was before.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: You peasant swain! you whoreson malt-horse drudge!
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Did I not bid thee meet me in the park,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And bring along these rascal knaves with thee?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Nathaniel's coat, sir, was not fully made,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And Gabriel's pumps were all unpink'd i' the heel;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: There was no link to colour Peter's hat,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And Walter's dagger was not come from sheathing:
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: There were none fine but Adam, Ralph, and Gregory;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: The rest were ragged, old, and beggarly;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Yet, as they are, here are they come to meet you.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Go, rascals, go, and fetch my supper in.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Where is the life that late I led--
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Where are those--Sit down, Kate, and welcome.--
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Sound, sound, sound, sound!
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Why, when, I say? Nay, good sweet Kate, be merry.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Off with my boots, you rogues! you villains, when?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: It was the friar of orders grey,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: As he forth walked on his way:--
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Out, you rogue! you pluck my foot awry:
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Take that, and mend the plucking off the other.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Be merry, Kate. Some water, here; what, ho!
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Where's my spaniel Troilus? Sirrah, get you hence,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And bid my cousin Ferdinand come hither:
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: One, Kate, that you must kiss, and be acquainted with.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Where are my slippers? Shall I have some water?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Come, Kate, and wash, and welcome heartily.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: You whoreson villain! will you let it fall?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Patience, I pray you; 'twas a fault unwilling.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: A whoreson beetle-headed, flap-ear'd knave!
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Come, Kate, sit down; I know you have a stomach.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Will you give thanks, sweet Kate; or else shall I?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: What's this? mutton?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Ay.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Who brought it?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: I.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: 'Tis burnt; and so is all the meat.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: What dogs are these! Where is the rascal cook?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: How durst you, villains, bring it from the dresser,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And serve it thus to me that love it not?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Theretake it to you, trenchers, cups, and all;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: You heedless joltheads and unmanner'd slaves!
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: What, do you grumble? I'll be with you straight.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: I pray you, husband, be not so disquiet:
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: The meat was well, if you were so contented.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: I tell thee, Kate, 'twas burnt and dried away;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And I expressly am forbid to touch it,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: For it engenders choler, planteth anger;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And better 'twere that both of us did fast,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Since, of ourselves, ourselves are choleric,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Than feed it with such over-roasted flesh.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Be patient; to-morrow 't shall be mended,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And, for this night, we'll fast for company:
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Come, I will bring thee to thy bridal chamber.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Peter, didst ever see the like?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: He kills her in her own humour.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Where is he?
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: In her chamber, making a sermon of continency to her;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And rails, and swears, and rates, that she, poor soul,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Knows not which way to stand, to look, to speak,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And sits as one new-risen from a dream.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Away, away! for he is coming hither.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Thus have I politicly begun my reign,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And 'tis my hope to end successfully.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: My falcon now is sharp and passing empty;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And till she stoop she must not be full-gorged,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: For then she never looks upon her lure.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Another way I have to man my haggard,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: To make her come and know her keeper's call,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: That is, to watch her, as we watch these kites
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: That bate and beat and will not be obedient.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: She eat no meat to-day, nor none shall eat;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Last night she slept not, nor to-night she shall not;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: As with the meat, some undeserved fault
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: I'll find about the making of the bed;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And here I'll fling the pillow, there the bolster,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: This way the coverlet, another way the sheets:
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Ay, and amid this hurly I intend
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: That all is done in reverend care of her;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And in conclusion she shall watch all night:
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And if she chance to nod I'll rail and brawl
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And with the clamour keep her still awake.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: This is a way to kill a wife with kindness;
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: And thus I'll curb her mad and headstrong humour.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: He that knows better how to tame a shrew,
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Now let him speak: 'tis charity to show.
scene_title: SCENE I.  PETRUCHIO'S country house.

line_text: Is't possible, friend Licio, that Mistress Bianca
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Doth fancy any other but Lucentio?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I tell you, sir, she bears me fair in hand.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Sir, to satisfy you in what I have said,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Stand by and mark the manner of his teaching.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Now, mistress, profit you in what you read?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What, master, read you? first resolve me that.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I read that I profess, the Art to Love.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And may you prove, sir, master of your art!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: While you, sweet dear, prove mistress of my heart!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Quick proceeders, marry! Now, tell me, I pray,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You that durst swear at your mistress Bianca
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Loved none in the world so well as Lucentio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O despiteful love! unconstant womankind!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I tell thee, Licio, this is wonderful.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Mistake no more: I am not Licio,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Nor a musician, as I seem to be;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But one that scorn to live in this disguise,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For such a one as leaves a gentleman,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And makes a god of such a cullion:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Know, sir, that I am call'd Hortensio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Signior Hortensio, I have often heard
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Of your entire affection to Bianca;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And since mine eyes are witness of her lightness,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I will with you, if you be so contented,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Forswear Bianca and her love for ever.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: See, how they kiss and court! Signior Lucentio,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Here is my hand, and here I firmly vow
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Never to woo her no more, but do forswear her,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: As one unworthy all the former favours
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That I have fondly flatter'd her withal.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And here I take the unfeigned oath,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Never to marry with her though she would entreat:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Fie on her! see, how beastly she doth court him!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Would all the world but he had quite forsworn!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For me, that I may surely keep mine oath,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I will be married to a wealthy widow,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Ere three days pass, which hath as long loved me
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: As I have loved this proud disdainful haggard.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And so farewell, Signior Lucentio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Kindness in women, not their beauteous looks,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Shall win my love: and so I take my leave,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: In resolution as I swore before.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Mistress Bianca, bless you with such grace
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: As 'longeth to a lover's blessed case!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Nay, I have ta'en you napping, gentle love,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And have forsworn you with Hortensio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Tranio, you jest: but have you both forsworn me?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Mistress, we have.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Then we are rid of Licio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I' faith, he'll have a lusty widow now,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That shall be wood and wedded in a day.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: God give him joy!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Ay, and he'll tame her.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: He says so, Tranio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Faith, he is gone unto the taming-school.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: The taming-school! what, is there such a place?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Ay, mistress, and Petruchio is the master;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That teacheth tricks eleven and twenty long,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To tame a shrew and charm her chattering tongue.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O master, master, I have watch'd so long
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That I am dog-weary: but at last I spied
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: An ancient angel coming down the hill,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Will serve the turn.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What is he, Biondello?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Master, a mercatante, or a pedant,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I know not what; but format in apparel,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: In gait and countenance surely like a father.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And what of him, Tranio?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If he be credulous and trust my tale,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I'll make him glad to seem Vincentio,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And give assurance to Baptista Minola,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: As if he were the right Vincentio
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Take in your love, and then let me alone.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: God save you, sir!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And you, sir! you are welcome.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Travel you far on, or are you at the farthest?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Sir, at the farthest for a week or two:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: But then up farther, and as for as Rome;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And so to Tripoli, if God lend me life.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: What countryman, I pray?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Of Mantua.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Of Mantua, sir? marry, God forbid!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And come to Padua, careless of your life?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: My life, sir! how, I pray? for that goes hard.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Tis death for any one in Mantua
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To come to Padua. Know you not the cause?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Your ships are stay'd at Venice, and the duke,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For private quarrel 'twixt your duke and him,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Hath publish'd and proclaim'd it openly:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Tis, marvel, but that you are but newly come,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You might have heard it else proclaim'd about.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Alas! sir, it is worse for me than so;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: For I have bills for money by exchange
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: From Florence and must here deliver them.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Well, sir, to do you courtesy,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: This will I do, and this I will advise you:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: First, tell me, have you ever been at Pisa?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Ay, sir, in Pisa have I often been,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Pisa renowned for grave citizens.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Among them know you one Vincentio?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: I know him not, but I have heard of him;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: A merchant of incomparable wealth.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: He is my father, sir; and, sooth to say,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: In countenance somewhat doth resemble you.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.
SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: and all one.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To save your life in this extremity,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: This favour will I do you for his sake;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And think it not the worst of an your fortunes
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: That you are like to Sir Vincentio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: His name and credit shall you undertake,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: And in my house you shall be friendly lodged:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Look that you take upon you as you should;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: You understand me, sir: so shall you stay
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Till you have done your business in the city:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: If this be courtesy, sir, accept of it.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: O sir, I do; and will repute you ever
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: The patron of my life and liberty.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Then go with me to make the matter good.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: This, by the way, I let you understand;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: my father is here look'd for every day,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: To pass assurance of a dower in marriage
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: 'Twixt me and one Baptista's daughter here:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: In all these circumstances I'll instruct you:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: Go with me to clothe you as becomes you.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

line_text: No, no, forsooth; I dare not for my life.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: The more my wrong, the more his spite appears:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: What, did he marry me to famish me?
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Beggars, that come unto my father's door,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Upon entreaty have a present aims;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: If not, elsewhere they meet with charity:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: But I, who never knew how to entreat,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Nor never needed that I should entreat,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Am starved for meat, giddy for lack of sleep,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: With oath kept waking and with brawling fed:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: And that which spites me more than all these wants,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: He does it under name of perfect love;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: As who should say, if I should sleep or eat,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: 'Twere deadly sickness or else present death.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I prithee go and get me some repast;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I care not what, so it be wholesome food.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: What say you to a neat's foot?
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: 'Tis passing good: I prithee let me have it.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I fear it is too choleric a meat.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: How say you to a fat tripe finely broil'd?
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I like it well: good Grumio, fetch it me.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I cannot tell; I fear 'tis choleric.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: What say you to a piece of beef and mustard?
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: A dish that I do love to feed upon.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Ay, but the mustard is too hot a little.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Why then, the beef, and let the mustard rest.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Nay then, I will not: you shall have the mustard,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Or else you get no beef of Grumio.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Then both, or one, or any thing thou wilt.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Why then, the mustard without the beef.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Go, get thee gone, thou false deluding slave,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: That feed'st me with the very name of meat:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Sorrow on thee and all the pack of you,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: That triumph thus upon my misery!
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Go, get thee gone, I say.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: How fares my Kate? What, sweeting, all amort?
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Mistress, what cheer?
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Faith, as cold as can be.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Pluck up thy spirits; look cheerfully upon me.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Here love; thou see'st how diligent I am
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: To dress thy meat myself and bring it thee:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I am sure, sweet Kate, this kindness merits thanks.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: What, not a word? Nay, then thou lovest it not;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: And all my pains is sorted to no proof.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Here, take away this dish.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I pray you, let it stand.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: The poorest service is repaid with thanks;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: And so shall mine, before you touch the meat.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I thank you, sir.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Signior Petruchio, fie! you are to blame.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Come, mistress Kate, I'll bear you company.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Much good do it unto thy gentle heart!
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Kate, eat apace: and now, my honey love,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Will we return unto thy father's house
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: And revel it as bravely as the best,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: With silken coats and caps and golden rings,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: With ruffs and cuffs and fardingales and things;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: With scarfs and fans and double change of bravery,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: With amber bracelets, beads and all this knavery.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: What, hast thou dined? The tailor stays thy leisure,

line_text: To deck thy body with his ruffling treasure.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Come, tailor, let us see these ornaments;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Lay forth the gown.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: What news with you, sir?
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Here is the cap your worship did bespeak.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Why, this was moulded on a porringer;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: A velvet dish: fie, fie! 'tis lewd and filthy:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Why, 'tis a cockle or a walnut-shell,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: A knack, a toy, a trick, a baby's cap:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Away with it! come, let me have a bigger.

line_text: I'll have no bigger: this doth fit the time,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: And gentlewomen wear such caps as these
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: When you are gentle, you shall have one too,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: And not till then.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.
SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Why, sir, I trust I may have leave to speak;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: And speak I will; I am no child, no babe:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Your betters have endured me say my mind,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: And if you cannot, best you stop your ears.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Or else my heart concealing it will break,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Even to the uttermost, as I please, in words.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: A custard-coffin, a bauble, a silken pie:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I love thee well, in that thou likest it not.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Love me or love me not, I like the cap;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: And it I will have, or I will have none.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Like to a censer in a barber's shop:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: You bid me make it orderly and well,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Go, hop me over every kennel home,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: For you shall hop without my custom, sir:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I'll none of it: hence! make your best of it.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: I never saw a better-fashion'd gown,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: More quaint, more pleasing, nor more commendable:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Why, true; he means to make a puppet of thee.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: thou thimble,

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: O, fie, fie, fie!
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Go take it hence; be gone, and say no more.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Tailor, I'll pay thee for thy gown tomorrow:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Take no unkindness of his hasty words:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Away! I say; commend me to thy master.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Well, come, my Kate; we will unto your father's
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Even in these honest mean habiliments:
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Our purses shall be proud, our garments poor;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: For 'tis the mind that makes the body rich;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: And as the sun breaks through the darkest clouds,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: So honour peereth in the meanest habit.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: What is the jay more precious than the lark,
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: O, no, good Kate; neither art thou the worse
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: For this poor furniture and mean array.
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: if thou account'st it shame. lay it on me;
scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

scene_title: SCENE III.  A room in PETRUCHIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, this is the house: please it you that I call?
scene_title: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

scene_title: SCENE IV.  Padua. Before BAPTISTA'S house.

scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Is't so, indeed.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Help, help, help! here's a madman will murder me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Help, son! help, Signior Baptista!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Prithee, Kate, let's stand aside and see the end of
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: this controversy.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, what are you that offer to beat my servant?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: What am I, sir! nay, what are you, sir? O immortal
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: gods! O fine villain! A silken doublet! a velvet
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: hose! a scarlet cloak! and a copatain hat! O, I
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: am undone! I am undone! while I play the good
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: husband at home, my son and my servant spend all at
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: the university.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: How now! what's the matter?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: What, is the man lunatic?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, you seem a sober ancient gentleman by your
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: habit, but your words show you a madman. Why, sir,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: what 'cerns it you if I wear pearl and gold? I
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: thank my good father, I am able to maintain it.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Thy father! O villain! he is a sailmaker in Bergamo.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: You mistake, sir, you mistake, sir. Pray, what do
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: you think is his name?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: His name! as if I knew not his name: I have brought
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: him up ever since he was three years old, and his
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: name is Tranio.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Away, away, mad ass! his name is Lucentio and he is
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: mine only son, and heir to the lands of me, Signior Vincentio.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Lucentio! O, he hath murdered his master! Lay hold
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: on him, I charge you, in the duke's name. O, my
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: son, my son! Tell me, thou villain, where is my son Lucentio?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Call forth an officer.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Carry this mad knave to the gaol. Father Baptista,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I charge you see that he be forthcoming.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Carry me to the gaol!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Stay, officer: he shall not go to prison.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Talk not, Signior Gremio: I say he shall go to prison.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Take heed, Signior Baptista, lest you be
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: cony-catched in this business: I dare swear this
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: is the right Vincentio.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Swear, if thou darest.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Nay, I dare not swear it.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Then thou wert best say that I am not Lucentio.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Yes, I know thee to be Signior Lucentio.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Away with the dotard! to the gaol with him!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Thus strangers may be hailed and abused: O
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: monstrous villain!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: O! we are spoiled and--yonder he is: deny him,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: forswear him, or else we are all undone.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.
SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Lives my sweet son?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Pardon, dear father.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: How hast thou offended?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Where is Lucentio?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Here's Lucentio,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Right son to the right Vincentio;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: That have by marriage made thy daughter mine,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: While counterfeit supposes bleared thine eyne.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Here's packing, with a witness to deceive us all!
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Where is that damned villain Tranio,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: That faced and braved me in this matter so?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Why, tell me, is not this my Cambio?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Cambio is changed into Lucentio.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Love wrought these miracles. Bianca's love
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Made me exchange my state with Tranio,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: While he did bear my countenance in the town;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And happily I have arrived at the last
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Unto the wished haven of my bliss.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: What Tranio did, myself enforced him to;
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Then pardon him, sweet father, for my sake.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I'll slit the villain's nose, that would have sent
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: me to the gaol.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: But do you hear, sir? have you married my daughter
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: without asking my good will?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Fear not, Baptista; we will content you, go to: but
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I will in, to be revenged for this villany.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And I, to sound the depth of this knavery.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Look not pale, Bianca; thy father will not frown.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: My cake is dough; but I'll in among the rest,
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Out of hope of all, but my share of the feast.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Husband, let's follow, to see the end of this ado.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: First kiss me, Kate, and we will.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: What, in the midst of the street?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: What, art thou ashamed of me?
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: No, sir, God forbid; but ashamed to kiss.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Why, then let's home again. Come, sirrah, let's away.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Nay, I will give thee a kiss: now pray thee, love, stay.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Is not this well? Come, my sweet Kate:
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Better once than never, for never too late.
scene_title: SCENE I.  Padua. Before LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: At last, though long, our jarring notes agree:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And time it is, when raging war is done,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: To smile at scapes and perils overblown.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: My fair Bianca, bid my father welcome,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: While I with self-same kindness welcome thine.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Brother Petruchio, sister Katharina,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And thou, Hortensio, with thy loving widow,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Feast with the best, and welcome to my house:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: My banquet is to close our stomachs up,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: After our great good cheer. Pray you, sit down;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: For now we sit to chat as well as eat.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Nothing but sit and sit, and eat and eat!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Padua affords this kindness, son Petruchio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Padua affords nothing but what is kind.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: For both our sakes, I would that word were true.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Now, for my life, Hortensio fears his widow.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Then never trust me, if I be afeard.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: You are very sensible, and yet you miss my sense:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I mean, Hortensio is afeard of you.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: He that is giddy thinks the world turns round.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Roundly replied.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Mistress, how mean you that?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Thus I conceive by him.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Conceives by me! How likes Hortensio that?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: My widow says, thus she conceives her tale.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Very well mended. Kiss him for that, good widow.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: 'He that is giddy thinks the world turns round:'
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I pray you, tell me what you meant by that.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Your husband, being troubled with a shrew,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Measures my husband's sorrow by his woe:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And now you know my meaning,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: A very mean meaning.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Right, I mean you.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And I am mean indeed, respecting you.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: To her, Kate!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: To her, widow!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: A hundred marks, my Kate does put her down.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: That's my office.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Spoke like an officer; ha' to thee, lad!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: How likes Gremio these quick-witted folks?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Believe me, sir, they butt together well.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Head, and butt! an hasty-witted body
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Would say your head and butt were head and horn.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Ay, mistress bride, hath that awaken'd you?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Ay, but not frighted me; therefore I'll sleep again.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Nay, that you shall not: since you have begun,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Have at you for a bitter jest or two!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Am I your bird? I mean to shift my bush;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And then pursue me as you draw your bow.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: You are welcome all.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: She hath prevented me. Here, Signior Tranio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: This bird you aim'd at, though you hit her not;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Therefore a health to all that shot and miss'd.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: O, sir, Lucentio slipp'd me like his greyhound,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Which runs himself and catches for his master.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: A good swift simile, but something currish.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: 'Tis well, sir, that you hunted for yourself:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: 'Tis thought your deer does hold you at a bay.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: O ho, Petruchio! Tranio hits you now.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I thank thee for that gird, good Tranio.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Confess, confess, hath he not hit you here?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: A' has a little gall'd me, I confess;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And, as the jest did glance away from me,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: 'Tis ten to one it maim'd you two outright.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Now, in good sadness, son Petruchio,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I think thou hast the veriest shrew of all.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Well, I say no: and therefore for assurance
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Let's each one send unto his wife;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And he whose wife is most obedient
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: To come at first when he doth send for her,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Shall win the wager which we will propose.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Content. What is the wager?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Twenty crowns.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Twenty crowns!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I'll venture so much of my hawk or hound,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: But twenty times so much upon my wife.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: A hundred then.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Content.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: A match! 'tis done.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Who shall begin?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: That will I.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Go, Biondello, bid your mistress come to me.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I go.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Son, I'll be your half, Bianca comes.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I'll have no halves; I'll bear it all myself.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: How now! what news?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Sir, my mistress sends you word
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: That she is busy and she cannot come.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: How! she is busy and she cannot come!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Is that an answer?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Ay, and a kind one too:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Pray God, sir, your wife send you not a worse.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I hope better.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Sirrah Biondello, go and entreat my wife
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: To come to me forthwith.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: O, ho! entreat her!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Nay, then she must needs come.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I am afraid, sir,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Do what you can, yours will not be entreated.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Now, where's my wife?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: She says you have some goodly jest in hand:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: She will not come: she bids you come to her.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Worse and worse; she will not come! O vile,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Intolerable, not to be endured!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Sirrah Grumio, go to your mistress;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Say, I command her to come to me.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I know her answer.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: What?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: She will not.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: The fouler fortune mine, and there an end.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Now, by my holidame, here comes Katharina!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: What is your will, sir, that you send for me?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Where is your sister, and Hortensio's wife?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: They sit conferring by the parlor fire.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Go fetch them hither: if they deny to come.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Swinge me them soundly forth unto their husbands:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Away, I say, and bring them hither straight.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Here is a wonder, if you talk of a wonder.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And so it is: I wonder what it bodes.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Marry, peace it bodes, and love and quiet life,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And awful rule and right supremacy;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And, to be short, what not, that's sweet and happy?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Now, fair befal thee, good Petruchio!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: The wager thou hast won; and I will add
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Unto their losses twenty thousand crowns;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Another dowry to another daughter,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: For she is changed, as she had never been.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Nay, I will win my wager better yet
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And show more sign of her obedience,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Her new-built virtue and obedience.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: See where she comes and brings your froward wives
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: As prisoners to her womanly persuasion.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Katharina, that cap of yours becomes you not:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Off with that bauble, throw it under-foot.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Lord, let me never have a cause to sigh,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Till I be brought to such a silly pass!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Fie! what a foolish duty call you this?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I would your duty were as foolish too:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: The wisdom of your duty, fair Bianca,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Hath cost me an hundred crowns since supper-time.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: The more fool you, for laying on my duty.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Katharina, I charge thee, tell these headstrong women
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: What duty they do owe their lords and husbands.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Come, come, you're mocking: we will have no telling.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Come on, I say; and first begin with her.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: She shall not.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I say she shall: and first begin with her.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Fie, fie! unknit that threatening unkind brow,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And dart not scornful glances from those eyes,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: To wound thy lord, thy king, thy governor:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: It blots thy beauty as frosts do bite the meads,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Confounds thy fame as whirlwinds shake fair buds,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And in no sense is meet or amiable.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: A woman moved is like a fountain troubled,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Muddy, ill-seeming, thick, bereft of beauty;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And while it is so, none so dry or thirsty
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Will deign to sip or touch one drop of it.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Thy husband is thy lord, thy life, thy keeper,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Thy head, thy sovereign; one that cares for thee,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And for thy maintenance commits his body
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: To painful labour both by sea and land,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: To watch the night in storms, the day in cold,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Whilst thou liest warm at home, secure and safe;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And craves no other tribute at thy hands
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: But love, fair looks and true obedience;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Too little payment for so great a debt.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Such duty as the subject owes the prince
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Even such a woman oweth to her husband;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And when she is froward, peevish, sullen, sour,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And not obedient to his honest will,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: What is she but a foul contending rebel
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And graceless traitor to her loving lord?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: I am ashamed that women are so simple
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: To offer war where they should kneel for peace;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Or seek for rule, supremacy and sway,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: When they are bound to serve, love and obey.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Why are our bodies soft and weak and smooth,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Unapt to toil and trouble in the world,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: But that our soft conditions and our hearts
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Should well agree with our external parts?
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Come, come, you froward and unable worms!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: My mind hath been as big as one of yours,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: My heart as great, my reason haply more,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: To bandy word for word and frown for frown;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: But now I see our lances are but straws,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Our strength as weak, our weakness past compare,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: That seeming to be most which we indeed least are.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Then vail your stomachs, for it is no boot,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And place your hands below your husband's foot:
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: In token of which duty, if he please,
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: My hand is ready; may it do him ease.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Why, there's a wench! Come on, and kiss me, Kate.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Well, go thy ways, old lad; for thou shalt ha't.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: 'Tis a good hearing when children are toward.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: But a harsh hearing when women are froward.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Come, Kate, we'll to bed.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: We three are married, but you two are sped.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: 'Twas I won the wager, though you hit the white;
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: And, being a winner, God give you good night!
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: Now, go thy ways; thou hast tamed a curst shrew.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.

line_text: 'Tis a wonder, by your leave, she will be tamed so.
scene_title: SCENE II.  Padua. LUCENTIO'S house.
